name: Space of Liberty (PAM)
description:
For the past decades, those looking at the intersections of planning, design, and public health have not considered architectural tectonics to be a solution against infectious diseases.

The current pandemic has brought the ultimate quest of designing spaces to circumvent infectious diseases to the forefront. It has pushed us to raise crucial questions to rethink our built environment and the way we practice. 

By creating spaces that prioritize health-giving attributes—through the circulation of airflow, spatial design, biophilic elements, natural light, and selection of the right building materials—architecture can be built for healing, and to support infection control into the environment for humans’ innate connection with nature. 

(Design by Ar Qhawarizmi - Malaysian Institute of Architects)
